item.title: Vehicle parking without permit in a space that does not belong to them, 30th July
item.description:
This vehicle has been parking in the space M244 which does not belong to them, and without a permit. They ignored notes asking for them to move the vehicle. The owner of the vehicle has been seen leaving 35 Merriam Avenue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merriam Avenue, Hackney, London

item.title: Manhole drain cover dangerous, 30th July
item.description:
I was just walking moments ago along the Bromley Road and nearly tripped and fell over this unsafe manhole drain cover full stop it appears to be blocked underneath but the metal appears to be bent upwards and therefore it is easy to trip over. Please can you come out as soon as possible and replace it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Bromley Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collected left here for weeks, 30th July
item.description:
This rubbish on Walworth Road outside Tankard pub - presumably from the pub? Has either not been collected or isn’t supposed to be there. It’s been there for at least a week - attracting more rubbish and litter. It is really depressing as a resident to walk past this every day. Can it be removed and there be an investigation into why it is there if it is not supposed to be and if dumping rubbish on the pavement is how it is put out for collection can levels of service be improved to make sure it doesn’t just sit there or some other arrangement be considered.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 178, Walworth Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A derelict public house has two sofas dumped in the courtyard along with a large amount of refuse. The boarded up property has been compromised with access now affordable via the entrance in the courtyard. This property is being used by squatters' with reports of drug use and anti social behaviour., 30th July
item.description:
The dumped sofas and refuse present a serious fire risk alongside the illegal use of this property by members of the public.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookhill Road, London

item.title: Someone is disposing of organic waste in the bin meant for non-recyclable and non-organic waste, 30th July
item.description:
There has been a persistent strong odor of organic waste coming from the trash bin located at the entrance of Shere House, apartments 24 to 31. Although this bin is designated ONLY for non-organic and non-recyclable waste, someone appears to be disposing of organic waste there. It would be advisable to put up a notice or, alternatively, check the security cameras to see what is happening. The smell is very unpleasant, attracts flies, and negatively affects the health of residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Dover Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flytipping, 30th July
item.description:
Current load has been here over a week why do we pay council tax?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cator Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor Cleaning Conditions in the Common Areas of Shere House (Apartments 24 to 31), 30th July
item.description:
The internal common areas of the apartment block covering units 24 to 31 at Shere House are in poor condition — dirty and with insufficient cleaning maintenance. In front of some of the apartments, there are heavy dirt stains, apparently from placing rubbish bags, as well as visible trails of dripping waste along the staircases. These stains have not been properly cleaned and are now forming permanent marks throughout the building, in addition to causing an unpleasant odor. Furthermore, the windows are dirty and covered in cobwebs, and the walls also show cobwebs and some mold spots. To make matters worse, it seems that one of the apartments is undergoing renovation, and the common areas have been left with sand, white dust, and nails scattered on the floor — all clear signs that cleaning maintenance has been poor. The staircases, walls, windows, floors, apartment entrances, and handrails are all in need of a deep cleaning. This situation seems to result mainly from insufficient maintenance and, possibly, from some residents not fully cooperating in keeping the shared areas clean. It would be nice if a polite notice to be circulated to all residents, kindly reminding them to help maintain the common areas in good condition and to take extra care when disposing of rubbish, ensuring that waste is not spilled or dripped on the stairs. Unfortunately, this careless practice has become somewhat common and contributes to making the shared spaces unsanitary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Dover Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
